commit_message:
Temporary fix ceilometer-collector dpkg bug 1221945

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1221945
The ubuntu cloud archive ceilometer-collector pkg has a bug in which init
script isn't installing properly gets installed as:
/etc/init/ceilometer-collector.conf.dpk-new therefore until it gets fixed this temp
solution works

Change-Id: Ie7a82f2b76e81c42c2880e3785fa9c164e7896a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-telemetry refs/changes/70/46370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # temp fix for collector init not installing properly ubuntu # See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1221945 if node["platform"] == "ubuntu" init_script = "/etc/init/ceilometer-collector.conf" execute "fix init script" do command "cp #{init_script}.dpkg-new #{init_script}" not_if { ::File.exists?(init_script) } end end

subject: Implement message controller.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-15 21:44:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/402687a6ecdf10ebf17d53065f1fc38e65abb1c9', 'message': "Implement message controller.

This patchset contributes a message controller for Marconi client. It
implements simple property querying for messages, as well as the
ability to reload these properties as needed (polling?) and delete a
message.

In order to meet these requirements, two new dependencies are added:
- flufl.enum
- six

flufl.enum adheres to the upcoming PEP 435 - enums in Python 3.4. It's
used to make Http interfaces safer to use and slightly easier to work
with.

six is used to boost py3k compat.

Note: This patchset was locally tested for py3k compatibility using
tox.

Change-Id: I287583ebff69c4571ae8164c99cff3b0628d23a1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-16 21:42:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/102ad0f0ec1085118ab4b6146499954d167cac00', 'message': "Implement message controller.

This patchset contributes a message controller for Marconi client. It
implements simple property querying for messages, as well as the
ability to reload these properties as needed (polling?) and delete a
message.

In order to meet these requirements, two new dependencies are added:
- flufl.enum
- six

flufl.enum adheres to the upcoming PEP 435 - enums in Python 3.4. It's
used to make Http interfaces safer to use and slightly easier to work
with. The portion of this code that implements safe HTTP method
selection has been placed in openstack.common.

six is used to boost py3k compat.

Note: This patchset was locally tested for py3k compatibility using
tox.

Implements: blueprint messages-management
Change-Id: I287583ebff69c4571ae8164c99cff3b0628d23a1
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-16 21:45:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/050da4a957fb044b3fde199bda674f8479f53a19', 'message': "Implement message controller.

This patchset contributes a message controller for Marconi client. It
implements simple property querying for messages, as well as the
ability to reload these properties as needed (polling?) and delete a
message.

In order to meet these requirements, two new dependencies are added:
- flufl.enum
- six

flufl.enum adheres to the upcoming PEP 435 - enums in Python 3.4. It's
used to make Http interfaces safer to use and slightly easier to work
with. The portion of this code that implements safe HTTP method
selection has been placed in openstack.common.

six is used to boost py3k compat.

commit_message:
Implement message controller.

This patchset contributes a message controller for Marconi client. It
implements simple property querying for messages, as well as the
ability to reload these properties as needed (polling?) and delete a
message. It also uses the assumed structure of the HTTPclient that
will form the basis of the connection from the common libraries.

six is used to boost py3k compat.

This also introduces a directory structure for supporting multiple
transports. Instead of having a 'controller' dir, now we have a
'transports/http' and 'transports/zmq'.

Implements: blueprint messages-management
Change-Id: I287583ebff69c4571ae8164c99cff3b0628d23a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/40/37140/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Easy creation of mock Marconi message replies.""" def message(href='https://mock.com', ttl=0, age=0, body=None): body = body or {} return { 'href': href, 'ttl': ttl, 'age': age, 'body': body }

commit_message:
task_state must be consider before many action

* Creating server status wait function for using with
  xml and json status wait.
* Considering fast status changes for BUILD status related tests.
  BUILD status wait can be useful when the server does
  not really need to be active for the test and we do not want to
  fail because the server reached the ACTIVE state before responding
  to the status query, due to rate limitation or for other reasons.
* Moving the wait function to new module, which could be used for
  collecting all wait related functionality.

  Fixing bug 1170118

Change-Id: Ie301124952412dab2b11a92a25ee54c633d08eeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/65/35165/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from tempest.common import log as logging from tempest import exceptions LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) #TODO(afazekas): Generalize for CLI usage. #TODO(afazekas): Handle scenario tests. #TODO(afazekas): Have the whitebox tests to use the scenario's solution. #NOTE(afazekas): This function needs to know a token and a subject. def wait_for_server_status(client, server_id, status): """Waits for a server to reach a given status.""" #NOTE(afazekas): UNKNOWN status possible on ERROR or in very early stages. resp, body = client.get_server(server_id) server_status = body['status'] start = int(time.time()) try: task_state = body['OS-EXT-STS:task_state'] except KeyError: task_state = 'not supported' while True: #NOTE(afazekas): Now the BUILD status only reached # between the UNKOWN->ACTIVE transition. #TODO(afazekas): enumerate the stable status set if status == 'BUILD' and server_status != 'UNKNOWN': return if server_status == status: if status == 'BUILD': return #NOTE(afazekas): Instance in a ready for action state # when no task in progress #TODO(afazekas): Add static wait option to ensure cleanness # without extension (3 sec usually enough) if task_state is None: return if task_state == 'not supported': LOG.warn('Waiting for task state without verification.') time.sleep(3) return time.sleep(client.build_interval) resp, body = client.get_server(server_id) server_status = body['status'] #TODO(afazekas): code duplication try: task_state = body['OS-EXT-STS:task_state'] except KeyError: task_state = 'not supported' if server_status == 'ERROR': raise exceptions.BuildErrorException(server_id=server_id) timed_out = int(time.time()) - start >= client.build_timeout if server_status != status and timed_out: message = ('Server %s failed to reach %s status within the ' 'required time (%s s).' % (server_id, status, client.build_timeout)) message += ' Current status: %s.' % server_status raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message)

subject: Ignore H803 from Hacking.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-12 06:31:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9fd58f8b2d01c4af44c378c98a36a5c3f8f785ed', 'message': 'Ignore H803 from Hacking.

H803 checks for a period in commit messages, something the community
clearly rejected as a sensible check: periods in commit messages

commit_message:
Ignore H803 from Hacking.

H803 checks for a period in commit messages, something the community
clearly rejected as a sensible check: periods in commit messages
should neither be rejected or required.

Change-Id: I866928c638d23a307f4c11b7cb947e88f90f1ab2

commit_message:
Need to allow quota values to be set to zero

There are test cases in tempest setting the value of quota to '0', we
need allow this scenario.

Fix bug 1191336

Change-Id: I205b523eddfcd3c253172ad4549142ceb9f9ee4e

commit_message:
Add tearDownClass to base swift test class

This commit fixes an oversight which was preventing isolated
credential cleanup on the swift tests.

Change-Id: Ia54297351d5889aa4a19b0fc452b45838392724a

commit_message:
Improves the parsing way of ssh returns

Huawei driver failed to parse ssh result when firstly logging
in storage system on paramiko 1.8.0. The update of paramiko
make the order of ssh returns changed. This patch improves
the parsing way of ssh returns.

This patch also does some changes for log punctuations.

fixes bug 1224499
Change-Id: Ia8761081dff998884f45312355b62aa27ab5417c

commit_message:
Test upgrade migration 16->17

This test covers the use case described in bug 1131590, where a
user_project_membership record cannot be upgraded past migration 16.

Closes-Bug: 1224320
Change-Id: Ia1bd03d0e07de316631140d55231abe74decaac1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/09/46109/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_upgrade_user_tenant_membership_to_metadata(self): self.upgrade(16) self.assertTableColumns( 'user_project_membership', ['user_id', 'tenant_id']) user = { 'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': 'default', 'extra': json.dumps({}), } project = { 'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': 'default', 'extra': json.dumps({}), } metadata = { 'user_id': user['id'], 'tenant_id': project['id'], } session = self.Session() self.insert_dict(session, 'user', user) self.insert_dict(session, 'project', project) self.insert_dict(session, 'user_project_membership', metadata) self.upgrade(17) user_project_metadata_table = sqlalchemy.Table( 'user_project_metadata', self.metadata, autoload=True) member_role_json = json.dumps({"roles": [CONF.member_role_id]}) result = session.query(user_project_metadata_table).one() self.assertEqual(result.user_id, user['id']) self.assertEqual(result.project_id, project['id']) self.assertEqual(result.data, member_role_json)

commit_message:
pci passthrough fails while trying to decode extra_info

pci device with empty extra_info should use null dict instead of
None. keep the init of extra_info to make db could access it.

Closes-Bug: #1223559

Change-Id: I2e57eb53dfd4f5168d52dc94c2057fc575458aee
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Merge changes to validate.py to test.py

The following changes were only applied to validate.py, apply them to
test.py as well:
* print process message
* Handle removed files in tools/validate.py
* Fix output of --force
* Don't descent into target dirs
* Update DocBook validating schema to 5.1CR1
* Add a tiny bit more verbosity

Change-Id: Ia3ee355e0e87c5748d83ae670ca845ee30d9646d

commit_message:
Adds disk_format parameter to upload_volume method in volumes client

Adds a third parameter, disk_format, to the upload_volume method of
the volumes client. The parameter is also added to the Tempest
configuration and defaults to "raw" if not set.

Closes-Bug: #1218666
Change-Id: I6c62796161c9219cbd80eb9fecc7fbb0f3a4681a

commit_message:
Add handoffs_first and handoff_delete to obj-repl

If handoffs_first is True, then the object replicator will give
partitions that are not supposed to be on the node priority.

If handoff_delete is set to a number (n), then it will delete a handoff
partition if at least n replicas were successfully replicated

Also fixed a couple of things in the object replicator unit tests and
added some more

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icb9968953cf467be2a52046fb16f4b84eb5604e4

This should make ``Ring.get_more_nodes`` microscopically faster.

commit_message:
Fix client connection leaks in HP3PAR drivers

In the presence of exceptions, hp3parclient connections
did not get closed. This fix adds try/finally blocks
around all client login/logout calls.

Change-Id: I105b06cea5e61f3e9cf0d6e19c7ce430fedad715
Closes-Bug: 1220948

commit_message:
Use the generic RequestLimitExceeded exception when possible

Rather than having lots of specific exceptions that all pertain to request
limitation, we can just use the RequestLimitExceeded exception when applicable,
which can also simplify the handling of exception mapping in fault.py.

Change-Id: I61b1e59912087fad286e74c22af15ffe6382bb65

commit_message:
VMware: fix driver support for hypervisor uptime

This method was previously not implemented and would throw an exception
with the tempest tests. It will now redirect the administrator to access
the host to het the uptime.

Fixes bug 1199946

Change-Id: I073f50fee6aa76e912753c0754d632ff2adfa287
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/41058/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime def get_host_uptime(self, host): """Returns the result of calling "uptime" on the target host.""" host_mor = vm_util.get_host_ref(self._session) quick_stats = self._session._call_method(vim_util, "get_dynamic_property", host_mor, "HostSystem", "summary.quickStats") return datetime.timedelta(seconds=quick_stats.uptime)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-03 17:17:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b034f993a790607bf3c4ab7ed7687441ef0cf4a8', 'message': "Get image properties instead of the whole image

image properties.

Fixes bug #1220318

commit_message:
Get image properties instead of the whole image

When booting an instance using the new BDMv2 API we can specify to boot
from a volume created from an image on the fly. In this case the API
should pass the image properties to the new instance so it can get some
important parameters that it might specify.

After adding the new BDMv2 API in 13180f76, we introduced a mistake in
the method that gets the image properties (from the boot BDM) if no
image_ref is defined. When the source is an image it will return the
whole image metadata instead of getting just the properties. This
causes that when the source image is an AMI the instance won't have the
ramdisk and kernel properties set and will fail to boot.

This patch fixes the image properties when booting from a volume created
from an image.

Fixes bug #1220318

Change-Id: Ibcd60510cc909fcaa0d6d4769f91c070dfaf22ff

commit_message:
Ensure default TTL is respected by PowerDNS backend

Previousally, all records without an explict TTL were defaulting to 3600
regardless of the per-zone default.

Change-Id: Idbfaad5303e05dfdc7bcbb371dd69d3e4f988a7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/29/46529/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Improve validate output

The output is now much more condensed:
Validating all files

commit_message:
Update Ceilometer alembic requirement to 0.6.0 version

Our ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/b6ae66d05e3_remove_extra_indexes.py call a new drop_constraint method with type_ argument,
but this new method argument is invovled from alembic 0.5.0 version, Jenkins is using alembic 0.6.0 version

Fixed bug: 1221467

Change-Id: I78f1e538c39fe4c972f21aa0fe77d3c82087176a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/04/46004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: alembic>=0.6.0

commit_message:
Hash device_id only if it is longer than the allowed MAX size for NVP

This ensure that a VM uuid stays untouched, avoiding potential
confusion when inspecting NVP port tags. This patch also abstracts
the hashing method out by introducing a device_id_to_vm_id method.
Filtering logic is preserved, and a test has been added to ensure
that. However such a logic is not currently used in the NeutronPlugin
(because of the introduction of async status updates), but it has
been added as utility method to nvplib.

Fixes bug #1215204

Change-Id: Ib96ecae438e30f195c8b45176abc1cf55b4b363f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/18/43218/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def device_id_to_vm_id(device_id): # device_id can be longer than 40 characters, for example # a device_id for a dhcp port is like the following: # # dhcp83b5fdeb-e3b4-5e18-ac5f-55161...80747326-47d7-46c2-a87a-cf6d5194877c # # To fit it into an NVP tag we need to hash it, however device_id # used for ports associated to VM's are small enough so let's skip the # hashing if len(device_id) > MAX_DISPLAY_NAME_LEN: return hashlib.sha1(device_id).hexdigest() else: return device_id dict(scope='vm_id', tag=device_id_to_vm_id(device_id)), dict(scope='vm_id', tag=device_id_to_vm_id(device_id)),
deleted_lines: # device_id can be longer than 40 so we rehash it hashed_device_id = hashlib.sha1(device_id).hexdigest() dict(scope='vm_id', tag=hashed_device_id), # device_id can be longer than 40 so we rehash it hashed_device_id = hashlib.sha1(device_id).hexdigest() dict(scope='vm_id', tag=hashed_device_id),

commit_message:
Configuration token replacement is incorrect for some topologies

HDP configuration tokens are now properly replaced for non co-located master services

Fixes bug: 1223434

Change-Id: I4380db4653ae4ba2c225eda79662b8eac84a55de

commit_message:
Add a --force option

This is a useful debugging and/or system fixer tool for instances where
metadata has not changed but one needs to re-run the configuration.

Fixes bug #1223693

Change-Id: I62b097bafa339fefcf6e03d11636f5ab622fb71a

commit_message:
Fixes the use of exception.InvalidInput with the wrong arguments

A mapping key of 'message' in exception.InvalidInput is 'reason'.
cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py and
cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/utils.py had used 'data'.

Change-Id: Ie40fc2f954984350827414edee9226adc80c8033
Closes-Bug: #1224790

commit_message:
Always log stdout and stderr of CLI commands

Currently it was logged only when cli subprocess call itself
failed, so there was not enough debug output when asserts/test cases
failed.

Also fixes invalid log.warning on newline at the end of ascii table.

For backport - as stderr was always merged to stdout in grizzly time
 - corresponding parts of the patch were removed.

(cherry picked from commit 0d9a84fb614fc65fa4417d1103d051a9580555df)

Conflicts:
	cli/__init__.py

Change-Id: I5251a06018e8bf79c30ad84f8f0ed8aac797f832

commit_message:
VMware: add debug log message for network injection

Change cda106c399a81d4027d3bb99f452fd4064405009 reverted back
to the pass. The review of that patch set indicated that all other
drivers should add the log messge.

Fixes bug 1218593

Change-Id: I770da55a1f7602be4119eefcbcc10b1e938d240c

subject: Add default_availability_zone configuration option to cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-09 08:21:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/abd22ee8e79d1afaa227f2b95d38560fa3a4ece4', 'message': 'Add default_availability_zone configuration option to cinder

This option is used to specify the default AZ for the whole service. So when
creating a new volume this value is used to specify the AZ of a volume.

Previously we were overloading the use of the storage_availability_zone option
which is also used to specify what AZ a service belongs to. We still fail back
on the storage_availability_zone when creating a new volume if the
defualt_availability_zone is not set.

Fixes bug: 1221260

Change-Id: Iec381f50c9aeb4a0abbcaa1d7b0107de09a73544
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2013-09-12 09:11:50.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/common/config.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/create_volume/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4fd5f9d68312776d10cc2ef775a76c0f3ece60de', 'message': 'Add default_availability_zone configuration option to cinder

This option is used to specify the default AZ for the whole service. So when
creating a new volume this value is used to specify the AZ of a volume.

Previously we were overloading the use of the storage_availability_zone option
which is also used to specify what AZ a service belongs to. We still fail back
on the storage_availability_zone when creating a new volume if the

Change-Id: Iec381f50c9aeb4a0abbcaa1d7b0107de09a73544

commit_message:
Add default_availability_zone configuration option to cinder

This option is used to specify the default AZ for the whole service. So when
creating a new volume this value is used to specify the AZ of a volume.

Previously we were overloading the use of the storage_availability_zone option
which is also used to specify what AZ a service belongs to. We still fail back
on the storage_availability_zone when creating a new volume if the
default_availability_zone is not set.

Fixes bug: 1221260

Change-Id: Iec381f50c9aeb4a0abbcaa1d7b0107de09a73544
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/45631/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_volume_uses_default_availability_zone(self): """Test setting availability_zone correctly during volume create""" volume_api = cinder.volume.api.API() def fake_list_availability_zones(): return ({'name': 'az1', 'available': True}, {'name': 'az2', 'available': True}, {'name': 'default-az', 'available': True}) self.stubs.Set(volume_api, 'list_availability_zones', fake_list_availability_zones) # Test backwards compatibility CONF.set_override('storage_availability_zone', 'az2') volume = volume_api.create(self.context, 1, 'name', 'description') self.assertEqual(volume['availability_zone'], 'az2') CONF.set_override('storage_availability_zone', 'az2') CONF.set_override('default_availability_zone', 'default-az') volume = volume_api.create(self.context, 1, 'name', 'description') self.assertEqual(volume['availability_zone'], 'default-az')

commit_message:
Add shell variables instead of ID values

Updates "Setting up tenants, users, and roles - manually"
section of the keystone install guide with shell variables
for each of the IDs referenced.
Fixed formatting by adding <screen><prompt>$</prompt> around <userinput>
Formatting: Replaced \t with whitespace, changed <literal> id Value
</literal> to <literal>id</literal> value, changed users to user's.

Change-Id: I4385d322a7b739cf78bc420c5617e69c01eb2810
Closes-Bug: #1073383

commit_message:
Minor cleanups on FWaaS message strings

Closes-Bugs: #1224839

- Remove a trailing colon for better consistency of the item names
  in FWaaS rule detail.
- Add a missing space in the message in FWaaS policy creation form.

Change-Id: Ie09a9266831064f0c4b588f8abfd799dfeeb3a33

The python-clients are very different in how they are logging,
the cinder and nova clients needs and additional option.

The nova and cinder python client wants to create unnecessary logger
 to the console, unless you add a handler earlier.

'}]
commit_message:
Add logging to the python-clients

The python-clients are very different in how they are logging,
the cinder and nova clients needs and additional option.

This change enables the http request/response logging to the
 nova and cinder python client.

The nova and cinder python client wants to create unnecessary logger
 to the console, unless you add a handler earlier.

Change-Id: I5bc72e52d16d2380ee36c8586cd1694ac1b4fa3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/68/43868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Stop doing special things with setuptools

pip 1.4 can handle the distribute/setuptools upgrade sequencing
appropriate. So it turns out all we need to upgrade is pip, and then the
rest will fall in to place. This will still not fix the packages vs. pip
interactions, but we don't to muck with the system setuptools packages
at all.

Change-Id: I99220ccc190798c3eb77bb2361abc6606bd546b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/81/41281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_package python-setuptools # Eradicate any and all system packages uninstall_package python-pip if [[ -n "$USE_GET_PIP" ]]; then install_get_pip else install_pip_tarball get_versions
deleted_lines: function setuptools_ez_setup() { if [[ ! -r $FILES/ez_setup.py ]]; then (cd $FILES; \ curl -OR $SETUPTOOLS_EZ_SETUP_URL; \ ) fi sudo python $FILES/ez_setup.py }# Do setuptools if [[ -n "$SETUPTOOLS" ]]; then # We want it from source uninstall_package python-setuptools setuptools_ez_setup else # See about installing the distro setuptools if ! python -c "import setuptools"; then install_package python-setuptools fi fiif [[ -z $PIP || "$PIP_VERSION" != "$INSTALL_PIP_VERSION" || -n $FORCE ]]; then # Eradicate any and all system packages uninstall_package python-pip if [[ -n "$USE_GET_PIP" ]]; then install_get_pip else install_pip_tarball fi get_versions

commit_message:
Store list of collected configs in cachedir

This will allow tools like os-apply-config to read the list even when
they are run out of band from os-collect-config.

Change-Id: Ic4eaf649e234f4a1367d20c7ec52e93e787a7bb3

commit_message:
Add --print-cachedir option

The option allows other programs to find the cache directory and files
without having access to OS_CONFIG_FILES.

Change-Id: Iad87efb65ea4db387e94160376c9eaf956fff413
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config refs/changes/97/46397/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_main_print_cachedir(self): fake_cachedir = self.useFixture(fixtures.TempDir()) fake_args = [ 'os-collect-config', '--cachedir', fake_cachedir.path, '--config-file', '/dev/null', '--print-cachedir', ] output = self.useFixture(fixtures.StringStream('stdout')) self.useFixture( fixtures.MonkeyPatch('sys.stdout', output.stream)) self._call_main(fake_args) cache_dir = output.getDetails()['stdout'].as_text() self.assertEquals(fake_cachedir.path, cache_dir)

Remove obsolete global service password.

This is no longer used - it didn't fit the keystone modelling of
services, and with the services fixed there is no need for this
anymore.

Change-Id: Ie0f9a05202aa70f9b599b3767fd68460ec35a24d

commit_message:
Set unique credentials for OpenStack services.

Rather than them all being "unset", give them unique values.

Change-Id: Ieeea664036ac1ef98d5e586480f4aa1d966e7884
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/45/46445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1. Create secrets for the cloud. Note that you can also make or change these later and update the heat stack definition to inject them - as long as you also update the keystone recorded password. Note that there will be a window between updating keystone and instances where they will disagree and service will be down. Instead consider adding a new service account and changing everything across to it, then deleting the old account after the cluster is updated. UNDERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) UNDERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) UNDERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) UNDERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) -P "PowerUserName=$(whoami);AdminToken=${UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN};AdminPassword=${UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD};GlancePassword=${UNDERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD};HeatPassword=${UNDERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD};NeutronPassword=${UNDERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD};NovaPassword=${UNDERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD}" \ init-keystone -p $UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD $UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN \ $UNDERCLOUD_IP admin@example.com heat-admin@$UNDERCLOUD_IP setup-endpoints $UNDERCLOUD_IP --glance-password $UNDERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD \ --heat-password $UNDERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD \ --neutron-password $UNDERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD \ --nova-password $UNDERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) OVERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD=$(os-make-password) -P "AdminToken=${OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN};AdminPassword=${OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD};CinderPassword=${OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD};GlancePassword=${OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD};HeatPassword=${OVERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD};NeutronPassword=${OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD};NovaPassword=${OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD}" \ overcloud init-keystone -p $OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD $OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN \ $OVERCLOUD_IP admin@example.com heat-admin@$OVERCLOUD_IP setup-endpoints $OVERCLOUD_IP --cinder-password $OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD \ --glance-password $OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD \ --heat-password $UNDERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD \ --neutron-password $OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD \ --nova-password $OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD
deleted_lines: 1. Create secrets for the cloud. -P "PowerUserName=$(whoami);AdminToken=${UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN};AdminPassword=${UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD}" \ init-keystone -p $UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD $UNDERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN $UNDERCLOUD_IP admin@example.com heat-admin@$UNDERCLOUD_IP setup-endpoints $UNDERCLOUD_IP -P "AdminToken=${OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN};AdminPassword=${OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWPRD}" overcloud init-keystone -p $OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD $OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN $OVERCLOUD_IP admin@example.com heat-admin@$OVERCLOUD_IP setup-endpoints $OVERCLOUD_IP

commit_message:
Fix badly scoped Neutron parameters.

The global service-password is wrong because we have
per-service-account passwords. As we start to set these values,
breakage is becoming visible.

Change-Id: Ib1b35692163cebc173d4378959027083ddf2354b

commit_message:
Support --os-cacert
    * Rename --ca-file to --os-cacert (--ca-file deprecated for
      backward compatibility)
    * Add cacert to keystoneclient initialization to verify the
      keystone server certificate

    This aligns ceilometerclient with keystoneclient for option naming
    and the use of TLS for the keystone auth connection.  It does not
    change the use of TLS/SSL for the glance connection.

Change-Id: I81cbbffd2b2b05bc3660e752e7543371c3fe5887
Closes-Bug: #1224343

commit_message:
Make field validation to be conditional.

Introduce new field attribute 'enabled' - true by default, but if it
is false, then the field won't be validated, only coerced to Python
type. This actually solves the issue with hidden (and disabled) fields
which don't validate and prevent proceeding to next step.

Change-Id: Ie57fa4731792ed1e44e9f61fa5cb6a16ddaf3109
Fixes: bug MRN-883

commit_message:
Make field validation to be conditional.

Introduce new field attribute 'enabled' - true by default, but if it
is false, then the field won't be validated, only coerced to Python
type. This actually solves the issue with hidden (and disabled) fields
which don't validate and prevent proceeding to next step.

Cherry-picked from release0.2, Ie57fa4731792ed1e44e9f61fa5cb6a16ddaf3109
Fixes: bug MRN-883

Change-Id: I4fc438a8949957800fcd0ac55bb30cd62744b1e0

commit_message:
Migrate remaining TEXT columns to LONGTEXT

To avoid cases where mysql silently truncates json data
when it is > 2^16 bytes, migrate all remaining TEXT columns
to LONGTEXT, in a similar way to the fix for bug #1210799

Combined with the fix for bug #1215501 which limits the request
body size, we should never truncate, even if mysql is configured
such that it can happen

Fixes bug #1223029

Change-Id: Ib536cfa8e2952a5e047cd8573288cdd9fee0622c

commit_message:
Fix incorrect NotImplementedError

neutron.common.exceptions doesn't define NotImplementedError, but
some codes still use it. We should use builtin
exceptions.NotImplementedError instead.

Note: this patch also fixes a never run code in nvp.

Closes-Bug: #1221500
Change-Id: I5f367ab5edc1e7fbbc2e4eba5fe36d148d4d062d

commit_message:
Fixing UnicodeEncodeError against volume creating function

When creating a volume with non-English characters and there is
not enough space for it, then an UnicodeEncodeError occurs. So
we need convert any coded exception message to unicode string
for logging.

Fixes bug 1223128

Change-Id: If1d4faad2bcde696f20565deb01226de33caccad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/12/46012/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_exception_to_unicode(self): class FakeException(Exception): def __str__(self): raise UnicodeError() exc = Exception('error message') ret = create_volume._exception_to_unicode(exc) self.assertEqual(unicode, type(ret)) self.assertEqual(ret, 'error message') exc = Exception('\xa5 error message') ret = create_volume._exception_to_unicode(exc) self.assertEqual(unicode, type(ret)) self.assertEqual(ret, ' error message') exc = FakeException('\xa5 error message') ret = create_volume._exception_to_unicode(exc) self.assertEqual(unicode, type(ret)) self.assertEqual(ret, _("Caught '%(exception)s' exception.") % {'exception': 'FakeException'})

commit_message:
Turn db model object into a primitive object to avoid error

In volume API controller we need turn db model object into a primitive
object to avoid error when it adding visible administrator metadata to
volume's metadata dict.

Fixes bug: 1220232

Change-Id: I5f6c4fc8dd6ca3af02db577b37dcaeee92bb42e5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Do not reschedule if copy_image_to_volume fails

Catch any exception raised by copy_image_to_volume and wrap them
in ImageCopyFailure. Raising ImageCopyFailure will prevent
the volume from being rescheduled.

Fixes: bug #1224211
Change-Id: I1366f86927813cadefe742769eb7cff27ed41b7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/46176/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self._copy_image_to_volume(context, volume_ref, image_service, image_id) except Exception as ex: raise exception.ImageCopyFailure(reason=ex)

commit_message:
Add in Neutron service password.

The in-instance scripts are being fixed to not confuse the admin
password with the neutron service password.

Change-Id: I341574bb838a9563120791b9ac014d75274a96aa

commit_message:
Exposes compute rt.resize_claim through compute.rpcapi

ResourceTracker is a compute specific thing and thus we
need to expose resize_claim method via compute.rpcapi to
be accessible on conductor when we move cold migration
code to there.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: I01233ac32b740936f059907313550a17fef2c164
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/39935/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.35 - Added resize_claim() def resize_claim(self, ctxt, instance, instance_type, limits=None, node=None): instance_p = jsonutils.to_primitive(instance) instance_type_p = jsonutils.to_primitive(instance_type) topic = _compute_topic(self.topic, ctxt, None, instance) return self.call(ctxt, self.make_msg('resize_claim', instance=instance_p, instance_type=instance_type_p, limits=limits, node=node), topic, version='2.35')

subject: Refactoring of FC volume attach/detach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-12 21:06:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9e98c6b7d86c18dd403bd24abcfe56ecfbf987a8', 'message': "Refactoring of iSCSI and FC volume attach/detach

This patch reworks the kvm libvirt volume drivers
for both iSCSI and Fibre Channel to use the new
'Brick' library that has originated in Cinder.
Cinder currently uses this code for when it needs
to attach an iSCSI or FC volume to do work.

Once this lands in Nova, we will push to have brick
accepted into OSLO.

blueprint refactor-iscsi-fc-brick

commit_message:
Refactoring of FC volume attach/detach

This patch adds the cinder brick library into nova.
It also refactors the kvm libvirt volume driver
to use the new brick connector object.
This also refactors the way we fetch the iscsi
initiator information and the fibre channel
wwns and wwpns.

A follow up patch will include the refactoring of
the kvm libvirt iSCSI volume driver.

Once this lands in Nova, we will push to have brick
accepted into OSLO.

blueprint refactor-iscsi-fc-brick

Change-Id: Ie3723e923e89fcaf1f6b33e15935e0c9c4d8e2df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/41528/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # (c) Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Generic linux Fibre Channel utilities.""" import errno import executor import linuxscsi from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from nova.openstack.common import log as logging from nova.openstack.common import processutils as putils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class LinuxFibreChannel(linuxscsi.LinuxSCSI): def __init__(self, execute=putils.execute, root_helper="sudo", *args, **kwargs): super(LinuxFibreChannel, self).__init__(execute, root_helper, *args, **kwargs) def rescan_hosts(self, hbas): for hba in hbas: self.echo_scsi_command("/sys/class/scsi_host/%s/scan" % hba['host_device'], "- - -") def get_fc_hbas(self): """Get the Fibre Channel HBA information.""" out = None try: out, err = self._execute('systool', '-c', 'fc_host', '-v', run_as_root=True, root_helper=self._root_helper) except putils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: # This handles the case where rootwrap is used # and systool is not installed # 96 = nova.cmd.rootwrap.RC_NOEXECFOUND: if exc.exit_code == 96: LOG.warn(_("systool is not installed")) return [] except OSError as exc: # This handles the case where rootwrap is NOT used # and systool is not installed if exc.errno == errno.ENOENT: LOG.warn(_("systool is not installed")) return [] if out is None: raise RuntimeError(_("Cannot find any Fibre Channel HBAs")) lines = out.split('\n') # ignore the first 2 lines lines = lines[2:] hbas = [] hba = {} lastline = None for line in lines: line = line.strip() # 2 newlines denotes a new hba port if line == '' and lastline == '': if len(hba) > 0: hbas.append(hba) hba = {} else: val = line.split('=') if len(val) == 2: key = val[0].strip().replace(" ", "") value = val[1].strip() hba[key] = value.replace('"', '') lastline = line return hbas def get_fc_hbas_info(self): """Get Fibre Channel WWNs and device paths from the system, if any.""" # Note(walter-boring) modern linux kernels contain the FC HBA's in /sys # and are obtainable via the systool app hbas = self.get_fc_hbas() hbas_info = [] for hba in hbas: wwpn = hba['port_name'].replace('0x', '') wwnn = hba['node_name'].replace('0x', '') device_path = hba['ClassDevicepath'] device = hba['ClassDevice'] hbas_info.append({'port_name': wwpn, 'node_name': wwnn, 'host_device': device, 'device_path': device_path}) return hbas_info def get_fc_wwpns(self): """Get Fibre Channel WWPNs from the system, if any.""" # Note(walter-boring) modern linux kernels contain the FC HBA's in /sys # and are obtainable via the systool app hbas = self.get_fc_hbas() wwpns = [] if hbas: for hba in hbas: if hba['port_state'] == 'Online': wwpn = hba['port_name'].replace('0x', '') wwpns.append(wwpn) return wwpns def get_fc_wwnns(self): """Get Fibre Channel WWNNs from the system, if any.""" # Note(walter-boring) modern linux kernels contain the FC HBA's in /sys # and are obtainable via the systool app hbas = self.get_fc_hbas() wwnns = [] if hbas: for hba in hbas: if hba['port_state'] == 'Online': wwnn = hba['node_name'].replace('0x', '') wwnns.append(wwnn) return wwnns

commit_message:
Unify aggregate-based conf overrides in scheduler

Move the common logic of overriding conf options with aggregate metadata
from AggregateCoreFilter and AggregateRamFilter to ConfAggregateOverride.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

Change-Id: Ie8ab4ddf171ec74346b581227a8cdf0183e86b54

added_lines: from nova.scheduler import utils as scheduler_utils return scheduler_utils.get_config(host_state, filter_properties, 'ram_allocation_ratio')
deleted_lines: from nova import db context = filter_properties['context'].elevated() # TODO(uni): DB query in filter is a performance hit, especially for # system with lots of hosts. Will need a general solution here to fix # all filters with aggregate DB call things. metadata = db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_host( context, host_state.host, key='ram_allocation_ratio') aggregate_vals = metadata.get('ram_allocation_ratio', set()) num_values = len(aggregate_vals) if num_values == 0: return CONF.ram_allocation_ratio if num_values > 1: LOG.warning(_("%(num_values)d ratio values found, " "of which the minimum value will be used."), {'num_values': num_values}) try: ratio = float(min(aggregate_vals)) except ValueError as e: LOG.warning(_("Could not decode ram_allocation_ratio: '%s'"), e) ratio = CONF.ram_allocation_ratio return ratio

commit_message:
Extend conf overrides to support more opt types

Add generic support for StrOpt, ListOpt, IntOpt and BoolOpt.
Required for supporting other filters overriding conf options
with aggregate metadata.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

Change-Id: I6fa1ebb29b4f311a2e6bfcdb799d48d76e02e3a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/44701/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt("test_int", default=1, help="Int type"), cfg.BoolOpt("test_bool", default=True, help="Bool type"), cfg.ListOpt("test_list", default=['lst1', 'lst2', 'lst3'], help="List type"), 'test_str': 'agg_string', 'test_int': 2, 'test_list': 'agg_lst1,agg_lst2,agg_lst3', 'test_bool': False, result = self.override.get_config(host_state, filter_properties, 'test_str') self.assertEqual(result, 'agg_string') result = self.override.get_config(host_state, filter_properties, 'test_int') self.assertEqual(result, 2) result = self.override.get_config(host_state, filter_properties, 'test_bool') self.assertEqual(result, False) result = self.override.get_config(host_state, filter_properties, 'test_list') self.assertEqual(result, ['agg_lst1', 'agg_lst2', 'agg_lst3']) def test_get_config_not_supported_value(self): metadata = {'test_float': 'two', filter_properties, 'test_float') self.assertEqual(result, 1.1)

subject: Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-04 10:48:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ec820e81e632947fb377dcf9cb852987257bbec2', 'message': "Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach

Attaching of a fibre channel LUN to an instance on ESX is enabled
by providing the details of the host's HBA wwnn(s) and wwpn(s) to
cinder. Cinder driver inturn provides the target wwpn and wwnn,
lun id of the target. This is used by the ESX nova driver
to attach the LUN to the instance

This patch addresses the the following points of the blueprint,
1. Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach to
   instances created on ESX
2. Support HP Cinder 3Par driver

If the instance is hosted in a cluster, then the presentation
of the LUN is done only to the host on which the instance is
hosted.

Presenting to multiple hosts will be implemented as a separate
patch

Change-Id: I7dbc57db5c669b447c2c13687621469f79f90d0f
Blueprint: fc-support-for-vcenter-driver

cinder. Cinder driver inturn provides the target wwpn and wwnn,
lun id of the target. This is used by the ESX nova driver
to attach the LUN to the instance

This patch addresses the the following points of the blueprint,
1. Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach to
   instances created on ESX
2. Support HP Cinder 3Par driver

If the instance is hosted in a cluster, then the presentation
of the LUN is done only to the host on which the instance is
hosted.

Presenting to multiple hosts will be implemented as a separate
patch

commit_message:
Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach

Attaching of a fibre channel LUN to an instance on ESX is enabled
by providing the details of the host's HBA wwnn(s) and wwpn(s) to
cinder. Cinder driver inturn provides the target wwpn and wwnn,
lun id of the target. This is used by the ESX nova driver
to attach the LUN to the instance

This patch addresses the the following points of the blueprint,
1. Enhance the vCenter driver to support FC volume attach to
   instances created on ESX
2. Support HP Cinder 3Par driver

If the instance is hosted in a cluster, then the presentation
of the LUN is done only to the host on which the instance is
hosted.

Presenting to multiple hosts will be implemented as a separate
patch

Change-Id: I7dbc57db5c669b447c2c13687621469f79f90d0f
Blueprint: fc-support-for-vcenter-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/35633/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.from nova.openstack.common import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) host_mors = get_hosts_ref(session, cluster) if host_mors: return host_mors[0] def get_hosts_ref(session, cluster=None, instance=None): """Get references of hosts within the cluster specified.""" if instance: vm_ref = get_vm_ref(session, instance) host_mor = session._call_method(vim_util, "get_dynamic_property", vm_ref, "VirtualMachine", "runtime.host") host_mors = [host_mor] elif cluster is None: host_mors = [host_mor] host_mors = host_ret.ManagedObjectReference return host_mors
deleted_lines: if cluster is None: host_mor = host_ret.ManagedObjectReference[0] return host_mor

commit_message:
Add AggregateDiskFilter

Implements blueprint per-aggregate-resource-ratio

* AggregateDiskFilter to support per-aggregate disk_allocation_ratio
* Falls back to global setting if per-aggregate value not found

DocImpact

Change-Id: I441bb962aee715bab829991519c7233ffefa4bbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/33950/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * |DiskFilter| - filters hosts by their Disk. Only hosts with sufficient Disk to host the instance are passed. * |AggregateDiskFilter| - filters hosts by Disk with per-aggregate disk_allocation_ratio setting. If no per-aggregate value found, it will fall back to the global default disk_allocation_ratio. If more than one value found for a host (meaning the host is in two differenet aggregate with different ratio settings, which should be avoid by administrator), the minimum value will be used... |DiskFilter| replace:: :class:`DiskFilter <nova.scheduler.filters.disk_filter.DiskFilter>` .. |AggregateDiskFilter| replace:: :class:`AggregateDiskFilter <nova.scheduler.filters.disk_filter.AggregateDiskFilter>`

commit_message:
Sanitize env variable for passlib

Sanitize the env variable PASSLIB_MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE
when the keystone starts. It will get rid of the
potential PasswordSizeError and unexpected security
issues of passlib.

Change-Id: I7140619a9288385471dd837fa3de0e0063605e01
Fixes: bug #1175905
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/22/43322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default max password size for passlib MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE_FOR_PASSLIB = '4096' # Sanitize the PASSLIB_MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE environment variable # in order to get rid of the unhandled PasswordSizeError # and other unexpected security issues of passlib. os.environ['PASSLIB_MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE'] = MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE_FOR_PASSLIB

commit_message:
Statistics: Add a "reset_on" query parameter

Add a "reset_on" query parameter that forces statistics to be computed every
time the value of a given field changes.

blueprint uptime-measurement

Change-Id: I2d9abb41b4293c9c3eba506f307a76e2ecaa4cc6

commit_message:
Add event/trait type queries

This patch adds storage queries for traits and
event types. Queries added in this patch set:

 * get_event_types - returns all event_types in
   the database. This is simply a string.
 * get_trait_types - returns all trait_types
   filtered by event_type.
 * get_traits - returns all trait data for an
   event_type, and an optional trait_type name.

In order to accomodate the new trait type table,
the storage model for trait is refactored, and a
new TraitType model is added. This model is necessary
because the api will provide a way to query trait
types without returning all trait data. Without
the TraitType model, there is no good way to return
a list of trait (name, data type) pairs to the api.

partial-bp specify-event-api

Change-Id: I6dcb26c1137692fc9a0dcc9770a53928666ab754

commit_message:
Implement 'reset_on' for mongodb

When given a 'reset_on' parameter equal to the name of one of the
resource_metadata fields, the get_meter_statistics() will return a list of
statistics such that every one of its elements refer to consecutive samples
that have the same value in this field.

blueprint uptime-measurement
Change-Id: Id2bf1c1d15e7498a9625a6f15a074c5338e74d59

added_lines: period_end : this.timestamp, watched_field_value : %s } ) period_end : new Date(period_start + period), watched_field_value : %s } ) REDUCE_STATS_RESET_ON = bson.code.Code(""" function (key, values) { res = {} var n_samples = values.length; /* We're looping through all the samples to group them according to the * value of the field specified in sample_filter.reset_on. New * statistics are computed every time this value (stored in * 'current_value') changes. In order to take into account the last * sample, we add a "sentinel" with a dummy value in its * resource_metadata['sample_filter.reset_on']. */ sentinel = { unit: values[n_samples - 1].counter_unit, min : values[n_samples - 1].counter_volume, max : values[n_samples - 1].counter_volume, sum : values[n_samples - 1].counter_volume, count : NumberInt(1), duration_start : values[n_samples - 1].timestamp+1, duration_end : values[n_samples - 1].timestamp+1, period_start : new Date(values[n_samples - 1].period_start+1), period_end : new Date(values[n_samples - 1].period_start+1), watched_field_value : null} values.push(sentinel) n_samples++; current_value = values[0].watched_field_value var subres = { unit: values[0].unit, min: values[0].min, max: values[0].max, count: NumberInt(values[0].count), sum: values[0].sum, period_start: values[0].period_start, period_end: values[0].period_end, duration_start: values[0].duration_start, duration_end: values[0].duration_end, watched_field_value: values[0].watched_field_value }; for (var i = 1; i < n_samples; i++) { /* The watched field might be null for some samples. Skip these * ones, assuming the value has not changed. * A "null" value might also indicate we have reached the sentinel, * so test for that. */ if (values[i].watched_field_value == null && i != (n_samples - 1)) continue; if (values[i].watched_field_value != current_value) { if (!res[current_value]) res[current_value] = [] subres.avg = subres.sum / subres.count; subres.duration = (subres.duration_end - subres.duration_start) / 1000; subres.period = NumberInt((subres.period_end - subres.period_start) / 1000); subres.watched_field_value = current_value res[current_value].push(subres); /* Starting a new set of stats. */ current_value = values[i].watched_field_value subres = { unit: values[i].unit, min: values[i].min, max: values[i].max, count: NumberInt(values[i].count), sum: values[i].sum, period_start: values[i].period_start, period_end: values[i].period_end, duration_start: values[i].duration_start, duration_end: values[i].duration_end, watched_field_value: values[i].watched_field_value }; } else { /* Update stats */ if ( values[i].min < subres.min ) subres.min = values[i].min; if ( values[i].max > subres.max ) subres.max = values[i].max; subres.count = NumberInt(subres.count + values[i].count); subres.sum += values[i].sum; if ( values[i].duration_start < subres.duration_start ) subres.duration_start = values[i].duration_start; if ( values[i].duration_end > subres.duration_end ) subres.duration_end = values[i].duration_end; } } return res; } """) if sample_filter.reset_on: reduce_function = self.REDUCE_STATS_RESET_ON finalize_function = None watched_field = "this.resource_metadata." + \ str(sample_filter.reset_on) else: reduce_function = self.REDUCE_STATS finalize_function = self.FINALIZE_STATS watched_field = "null" map_stats = self.MAP_STATS_PERIOD % (period, period_start, watched_field) else: map_stats = self.MAP_STATS % (watched_field) reduce_function, finalize=finalize_function, if sample_filter.reset_on: stats = [] for result in results['results']: for values in result['value'].values(): for value in values: stats.append((models.Statistics(**value))) return sorted(stats, key=operator.attrgetter('period_start')) else: return sorted((models.Statistics(**(r['value'])) for r in results['results']), key=operator.attrgetter('period_start'))

commit_message:
fakevm: plugin base and openvswitch plugin

blueprint integrated-test-without-nova

This patch add plugin base and openvswitch plugin.

Change-Id: I004dc3450c6f60499a98e903886c90bc62bd19b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/39267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 Isaku Yamahata <yamahata at private email ne jp> # <yamahata at valinux co jp> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # @author: Isaku Yamahata from abc import ABCMeta, abstractmethod import os import shlex import time from oslo.config import cfg from neutron.agent.common import config from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib from neutron.agent.linux import ovs_lib from neutron.agent.linux import utils from neutron.common.utils import dict2str from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NeutronFakeVMAgentPluginBase(object): __metaclass__ = ABCMeta OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('vif_wrapper', default=None, help=_('path to vif.py of fakevm')), cfg.StrOpt('nova_conf', default='/etc/nova/nova.conf', help=_('path to nova.conf')), cfg.BoolOpt('enable_multi_node_emulate', default=False, help=_('Enable the multiple node emulation')), ] DEV_NAME_LEN = 13 # NOTE(yamahata): for dhclient # != neutron.agent.linux.interface.DEV_NAME_LEN = 14 # Linux socket packet uses the first 13 # bytes for network interface name as # struct sockaddr_pkt::spkt_device[14] and it zeros # the last bytes. # If name is longer than 13, it fails to send packet # to the device via pakcet socket with ENODEV. def init(self, conf): self.conf = conf self.host = conf.FAKEVM.host self.path = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__)) self.root_helper = config.get_root_helper(self.conf) if not self.conf.FAKEVM.vif_wrapper: raise RuntimeError(_('need to specify the vif wrapper path')) @classmethod def _get_veth_pair_names(cls, vif_uuid): return (('qfb%s' % vif_uuid)[:cls.DEV_NAME_LEN], ('qfv%s' % vif_uuid)[:cls.DEV_NAME_LEN]) def _get_ns_name(self, vif_uuid): return 'fakevm-%s-%s' % (self.host, vif_uuid) # corresponds to # nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVifDriver.get_bridge_name() # return network['bridge'] # Not get_br_name() @abstractmethod def _get_vif_bridge_name(self, network_id, vif_uuid): pass # corresponds to # nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVifDriver.get_br_name() # return ("qbr" + iface_id)[:network_model.NIC_NAME_LEN] # Not get_bridge_name() def _get_probe_br_name(self, network_id, vif_uuid): return self._exec_vif_wrapper(['bridge-name', vif_uuid]) def _execute(self, cmd): utils.execute(cmd, root_helper=self.root_helper) def _device_exists(self, device): try: self._execute(['ip', 'link', 'show', 'dev', device]) except RuntimeError: return False return True def _ensure_bridge(self, br_name): if not self._device_exists(br_name): self._execute(['brctl', 'addbr', br_name]) self._execute(['brctl', 'setfd', br_name, str(0)]) self._execute(['brctl', 'stp', br_name, 'off']) self._execute(['ip', 'link', 'set', br_name, 'up']) else: time.sleep(1) # XXX: race def _ensure_ovs_bridge(self, ovs_bridge_name): ovs_br = ovs_lib.OVSBridge(ovs_bridge_name, self.root_helper) ovs_br.run_vsctl(['--', '--may-exist', 'add-br', ovs_bridge_name]) return ovs_br def _connect_ovs_lb(self, ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name, ovs_br, br_name): ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) ovs_veth, br_veth = ip_wrapper.add_veth(ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name) ovs_br.add_port(ovs_veth_name) self._execute(['brctl', 'addif', br_name, br_veth_name]) ovs_veth.link.set_up() br_veth.link.set_up() def _disconnect_ovs_lb(self, ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name, ovs_br, br_name): ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) ovs_veth, _br_veth = ip_wrapper.add_veth(ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name) self._execute(['brctl', 'delif', br_name, br_veth_name]) ovs_br.del_port(ovs_veth_name) ovs_veth.link.set_down() ovs_veth.link.delete() # _br_veth is also deleted. def _make_vif_args(self, instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name): instance = { 'host': self.host, 'uuid': instance_id, } network = { 'id': network_id, } if not bridge_name: bridge_name = self._get_vif_bridge_name(network_id, vif_uuid) network['bridge'] = bridge_name mapping = { 'vif_uuid': vif_uuid, 'mac': mac, } vif = (network, mapping) return (instance, vif) def _exec_vif_wrapper(self, subcmd): cmd = ['python'] cmd += [self.conf.FAKEVM.vif_wrapper] cmd += ['--config-file', self.conf.FAKEVM.nova_conf] cmd += subcmd return utils.execute(cmd) def _vif_plug(self, instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name=None): instance, vif = self._make_vif_args(instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name) network, mapping = vif cmd = ['plug', dict2str(instance), dict2str(network), dict2str(mapping)] self._exec_vif_wrapper(cmd) def _vif_unplug(self, network_id, vif_uuid, bridge_name=None): instance_id = 'dummy-instance-id' # unused by vif driver mac = 'un:us:ed:ma:ca:dr' # unused by vif driver instance, vif = self._make_vif_args(instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name) network, mapping = vif cmd = ['unplug', dict2str(instance), dict2str(network), dict2str(mapping)] self._exec_vif_wrapper(cmd) def _create_probe(self, br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, mac, br_name, ns_name): ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) br_veth, vm_veth = ip_wrapper.add_veth(br_veth_name, vm_veth_name) if br_name: self._execute(['brctl', 'addif', br_name, br_veth_name]) vm_veth.link.set_address(mac) if ns_name: ns_obj = ip_wrapper.ensure_namespace(ns_name) ns_obj.add_device_to_namespace(vm_veth) vm_veth.link.set_up() br_veth.link.set_up() def _delete_probe(self, br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, br_name, ns_name): ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) if ip_lib.device_exists(br_veth_name, root_helper=self.root_helper): br_veth = ip_wrapper.device(br_veth_name) br_veth.link.set_down() if br_name: self._execute(['brctl', 'delif', br_name, br_veth_name]) br_veth.link.delete() # vm_veth is also deleted. if ns_name and ip_wrapper.netns.exists(ns_name): ip_wrapper_ns = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper, ns_name) if ip_lib.device_exists(vm_veth_name, root_helper=self.root_helper, namespace=ns_name): vm_veth = ip_wrapper_ns.device(vm_veth_name) vm_veth.link.set_down() vm_veth.link.delete() ip_wrapper_ns.netns.delete(ns_name) def _probe_plug(self, network_id, vif_uuid, mac): br_veth_name, vm_veth_name = self._get_veth_pair_names(vif_uuid) br_name = self._get_probe_br_name(network_id, vif_uuid) ns_name = self._get_ns_name(vif_uuid) self._create_probe(br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, mac, br_name, ns_name) LOG.debug(_('ns %(ns_name)s eth %(veth_name)s'), {'ns_name': ns_name, 'veth_name': vm_veth_name}) def _probe_unplug(self, network_id, vif_uuid): br_veth_name, vm_veth_name = self._get_veth_pair_names(vif_uuid) br_name = self._get_probe_br_name(network_id, vif_uuid) ns_name = self._get_ns_name(vif_uuid) self._delete_probe(br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, br_name, ns_name) LOG.debug(_('ns %(ns_name)s eth %(veth_name)s'), {'ns_name': ns_name, 'veth_name': vm_veth_name}) def plug(self, instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name=None): self._vif_plug(instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name) self._probe_plug(network_id, vif_uuid, mac) def unplug(self, network_id, vif_uuid, bridge_name=None): self._probe_unplug(network_id, vif_uuid) self._vif_unplug(network_id, vif_uuid, bridge_name) def exec_command(self, vif_uuid, command): ns_name = self._get_ns_name(vif_uuid) ip_wrapper_ns = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper, ns_name) command = shlex.split(command) if command else '' return ip_wrapper_ns.netns.execute(command) cfg.CONF.register_opts(NeutronFakeVMAgentPluginBase.OPTS, 'FAKEVM')

commit_message:
Invert the reschedule exception list

Instead of having a list of exceptions that would be
checked to avoid rescheduling instead have a list of
exceptions that will cause rescheduling. This list will
be much smaller than a blacklist and likely will have
to be expanded as new failure modes that should attempt
rescheduling are found & whitelisted.

Change-Id: I164bf8f290680ae1edb3ad77b59cd555b969fc4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/08/44208/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # These exception types will trigger the volume to be rescheduled # instead of just setting the volumes status to error (and doing # appropriate notifications that this occured). self.do_reschedule_types = [ exception.FileNotFound, exception.NfsException, if exc_type in self.do_reschedule_types: return True # What other conditions should we check to see if the failure was # not fatal enough that we should avoid attempting a reschedule? return False
deleted_lines: # These exception types will trigger the volume to be set into error # status rather than being rescheduled. self.no_reschedule_types = [ # The volume has already finished being created when the exports # occur, rescheduling would be bad if it happened due to exports # not succeeding. exception.ExportFailure, # Image copying happens after volume creation so rescheduling due # to copy failure will mean the same volume will be created at # another place when it still exists locally. exception.ImageCopyFailure, # Metadata updates happen after the volume has been created so if # they fail, rescheduling will likely attempt to create the volume # on another machine when it still exists locally. exception.MetadataCopyFailure, exception.MetadataCreateFailure, exception.MetadataUpdateFailure, # The volume/snapshot has been removed from the database, that # can not be fixed by rescheduling. exception.VolumeNotFound, exception.SnapshotNotFound, exception.VolumeTypeNotFound, exception.ImageUnacceptable, if exc_type in self.no_reschedule_types: return False return True

fakevm: linuxbridge plugin

blueprint integrated-test-without-nova

This patch add linuxbridge plugin.

Change-Id: Ibd856e6640f26a27b52835166045f95c78a79921
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/39271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 Isaku Yamahata <yamahata at private email ne jp> # <yamahata at valinux co jp> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # @author: Isaku Yamahata # @author: Yoshihiro Kaneko import sys from neutron.debug.fakevm.plugins import base from neutron.extensions import portbindings from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging from neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.common import config # noqa LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NeutronFakeVMAgentLB(base.NeutronFakeVMAgentPluginBase): def __init__(self): super(NeutronFakeVMAgentLB, self).__init__() self.conf = None self.root_helper = None def init(self, conf): super(NeutronFakeVMAgentLB, self).init(conf) # The bridge created by linuxbridge plugin is named by fixed prefix # plus network-id. Therefore, this plug-in cannot support the multi # node emulation because it cannot avoid a bridge name conflicts. if self.conf.FAKEVM.enable_multi_node_emulate: LOG.error(_('FakeVM linuxbridge plugin does not support ' 'the multi node emulation.')) sys.exit(1) def cleanup(self): pass def _get_vif_bridge_name(self, network_id, vif_uuid): return 'brq' + network_id[0:11] def _get_veth_pair_names(self, vif_uuid): # linuxbridge plugin agent adds the interface having a name which # starts with 'tap' to a bridge return ('tap' + vif_uuid[0:11], ('qfv%s' % vif_uuid)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN]) def _make_vif_args(self, instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name): if not bridge_name: bridge_name = self._get_vif_bridge_name(network_id, vif_uuid) interface, vif = super(NeutronFakeVMAgentLB, self)._make_vif_args( instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name) network, mapping = vif mapping['vif_type'] = portbindings.VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE network['bridge_interface'] = '' mapping['should_create_bridge'] = True return (interface, vif) def _probe_plug(self, network_id, vif_uuid, mac): br_veth_name, vm_veth_name = self._get_veth_pair_names(vif_uuid) ns_name = self._get_ns_name(vif_uuid) self._create_probe(br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, mac, None, ns_name) def _probe_unplug(self, network_id, vif_uuid): br_veth_name, vm_veth_name = self._get_veth_pair_names(vif_uuid) br_name = self._get_vif_bridge_name(network_id, vif_uuid) ns_name = self._get_ns_name(vif_uuid) self._delete_probe(br_veth_name, vm_veth_name, br_name, ns_name)

commit_message:
fakevm: ryu plugin

blueprint integrated-test-without-nova

This patch add ryu plugin.

Change-Id: Ifba41c586ae5a228accd0ef1adc8423d9f99eac6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/69/39269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 Isaku Yamahata <yamahata at private email ne jp> # <yamahata at valinux co jp> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # @author: Isaku Yamahata from oslo.config import cfg from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib from neutron.debug.fakevm.plugins import base from neutron.extensions import portbindings from neutron.plugins.ryu.agent import ryu_neutron_agent from neutron.plugins.ryu.common import config # noqa class NeutronFakeVMAgentRyu(base.NeutronFakeVMAgentPluginBase): OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('vir_bridge', default='br-fakevm', help=_('bridge name to emulate multiple node')), cfg.BoolOpt('use_tunnel', default=False, help=_('use tunnel or not (set True when gre tunneling ' 'app)')), ] def __init__(self): super(NeutronFakeVMAgentRyu, self).__init__() self.conf = None self.root_helper = None self.int_br = None def init(self, conf): super(NeutronFakeVMAgentRyu, self).init(conf) if self.conf.FAKEVM.enable_multi_node_emulate: if self.conf.FAKEVM.use_tunnel: self._init_tunnel() else: self._init_bridge() def cleanup(self): if self.conf.FAKEVM.enable_multi_node_emulate: if self.conf.FAKEVM.use_tunnel: self._cleanup_tunnel() else: self._cleanup_bridge() def _get_vif_bridge_name(self, network_id, vif_uuid): return self.conf.OVS.integration_bridge def _init_bridge(self): br_name = self.conf.FAKEVM.vir_bridge self._ensure_bridge(br_name) self.int_br = self._ensure_ovs_bridge(self.conf.OVS.integration_bridge) ovs_veth_name = ('qfo' + self.conf.FAKEVM.host)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] br_veth_name = ('qfb' + self.conf.FAKEVM.host)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] self._connect_ovs_lb(ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name, self.int_br, br_name) def _cleanup_bridge(self): br_name = self.conf.FAKEVM.vir_bridge ovs_veth_name = ('qfo' + self.conf.FAKEVM.host)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] br_veth_name = ('qfb' + self.conf.FAKEVM.host)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] self._disconnect_ovs_lb(ovs_veth_name, br_veth_name, self.int_br, br_name) def _get_tunnel_name(self): # host name can have similar leading part. e.g. guest-1, guest-2 # use the trailing part in order to avoid name clash return 'qft' + self.host[-self.DEV_NAME_LEN + 3:] def _init_tunnel(self): self._cleanup_tunnel() dev_name = self._get_tunnel_name() tunnel_ip = ryu_neutron_agent._get_tunnel_ip() ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) if not ip_lib.device_exists(dev_name, self.root_helper): # ip link add $tunnel_interface type dummy device = ip_wrapper.add_dummy(dev_name) else: device = ip_wrapper.device(dev_name) # ip address add $tunnel_ip brd '+' scope global dev $dev_name device.addr.add(4, tunnel_ip, '+') # ip link set $tunnel_interface up device.link.set_up() #self._execute(['ip', 'route', 'add', tunnel_ip, 'dev', dev_name]) self._ensure_ovs_bridge(self.conf.OVS.integration_bridge) def _cleanup_tunnel(self): dev_name = self._get_tunnel_name() if ip_lib.device_exists(dev_name, self.root_helper): ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) ip_wrapper.device(dev_name).link.delete() def _make_vif_args(self, instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name): instance, vif = super(NeutronFakeVMAgentRyu, self)._make_vif_args( instance_id, network_id, vif_uuid, mac, bridge_name) network, mapping = vif mapping['vif_type'] = portbindings.VIF_TYPE_OVS mapping['ovs_interfaceid'] = vif_uuid return (instance, vif) cfg.CONF.register_opts(NeutronFakeVMAgentRyu.OPTS, 'FAKEVM')

commit_message:
Use Openstack common notifier

Now most of the OpenStack projects has replaceed the notification
code with Oslo's. This fix is using to track the change and
refactors the unit test code of notifier.

DocImpact
Fix bug 1020749

Change-Id: If3cd72e9e580ff9fbd1bbae8bd1493529e01a2a7
